website_summaries.verdict: The brand’s revamp of the longstanding Sundowner GTX certainly gathered mixed reviews. It received appreciation for its waterproofing, grip and retro look. However, this time, the cons exceeded its pros. The reputation of this backpacking boot was severely tarnished when hikers experienced subpar workmanship, inaccurate fit and sizing and its requirement of a lengthy break-in period. All in all, the Vasque Sundowner GTX may have reached the sunset of its lifetime.
pros: Its waterproofness was admirable, according to a number of satisfied users
Numerous owners said that the traction worked well
The majority admired the classic look of the Vasque Sundowner GTX
Most verified purchasers commented that they appreciated the comfort provided by the Sundowner GTX
Some outdoor enthusiasts liked its low weight
cons: According to a high percentage of disheartened wearers, the Vasque Sundowner GTX needed a significant time to break in
It runs small, based on many customer reviews
The quality of the Sundowner GTX declined tremendously, as stated by a lot of brand enthusiasts
Plenty of online buyers thought that they had wasted their money on the Vasque Sundowner GTX
Scores of owners were dismayed when the sole of the boot separated from the rest of the boot too soon

customer_reviews.title: Narrow fit.
customer_reviews.text: Not like the old ones. Fit is very narrow. Order wides and a half-size larger than you normally do. Update: After over 2 months of wearing these for outdoor work and hiking they show no sign of "loosening up" to fit better. I still suggest you get the wider size. When I ordered these I got a 1/2 size larger but that doesn't help with width. The toe box is extremely narrow and even with light socks (You'll never fit heavy winter socks in these things.) my toes hurt at the end of the day.
customer_reviews.author: Mike M.

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, but...
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots. They have a long history, going back decades. The workmanship is high; the stitch quality, leather selection, sole assembly and overall finish of my made-in-Vietnam pair was very well done. However, my wide foot finds the wide width of my pair to be barely so. I am keeping this pair, but I can state that if your foot is extra-wide, these Vasques will not work for you. The wide width I purchased is closer to a D width than to an EE. Great boots, but be aware!
customer_reviews.author: John R.

customer_reviews.title: Sundowners are back!
customer_reviews.text: Do your research and buy from a trusted source that will exchange/refund if you’re not happy. These new generation Vasque Sundowners are as close to the original ones without cutting corners. Good American leather from Redwing MN. Now assembled in Viet Nam with lots of quality control. They come in M/W sizes so go check them out. These definitely are superior to the ones from China. I will review again in a year’s time as I’ve only had these for 2 weeks. Hey Redwing if you’re reading this thx for reviving an old favorite hiking/backpacking boot...
customer_reviews.author: daniel thomas russell

customer_reviews.title: Best dam boots ever
customer_reviews.text: I normally don't give reviews on product that I buy unless one ask me for my opinion but this is time I will write a review these are the best dam boots I have ever bought and my 49 years of living thank you Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Jaytee davis

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I read a magazine article years ago about equipment used by backpackers who completed the Appalachian Trail, and a very high percentage used these boots. So, I decided to try them. I am now wearing my fourth pair, and continue to love them. Comfortable, stable, good support, not too heavy. Couldn't recommend them more highly. (They fit somewhat small, and I wear 1/2 size larger than normal.)
customer_reviews.author: Robert_in_CA

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I actually purchased two pair of these thinking I would send the color I didn't like back. They fit so well that I decided to just keep both and save one pair for the apocalypse. I had the Italian version back in the 90's and wore out the soles from years of using them every day. They were great! These so far seem comparable and probably a little lighter. I don't put on the miles of hiking like I did back in the day as I switched to lighter weight trail running type shoes for that, but these are great for general weekend activities, cutting wood and northern winters.
customer_reviews.author: PR

customer_reviews.title: Not Your Father's Sundowner
customer_reviews.text: I still have a pair of the original made in Italy Sundowners that were superbly made, good arch support and meticulous stitching. These are not the same quality. No arch support. No adequate scree shield. Run tight. Why would a company destroy a superb product to save on production costs? My old ones have gotten a little tight over the years (as people's feet tend to spread), so maybe I'll see if the shoemaker can stretch them. Otherwise Merrill makes comfortable hiking shoes. I sent these back.
customer_reviews.author: MNDoc

customer_reviews.title: Glad the Sundowner is back!
customer_reviews.text: After reading the other reviews I ordered half a size larger in a wide. Normally wear 101/2, ordered and 11 and in wide because the reviews suggest that. They are perfect. Had a pair years ago and was never able to reorder. Glad they have been brought back. There are some differences. The leather is stiffer, and the size varied from the original pair that I had. Read some negative reviews about the soles,but don’t plan on rugged hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Paul R. Moss

customer_reviews.title: Hiking 101
customer_reviews.text: Old school cool and built very well. These will take some time to break in but I can already tell they are going to be very comfortable. So far I have 10 miles hiking on them and 20 hours working outside in the wet with them and they are performing very well, the grip is amazing in mud which I need at my place. Will update if things change.
customer_reviews.author: jo

customer_reviews.title: Really like this boot
customer_reviews.text: Really like this boot. It runs a little narrow but I was looking for such a thing. I have crazy narrow feet usually an “A” or “B” width. With a heavy sock and an orthotic it fits fine. Other than that the leather is of good quality and the old school styling is cool. They do require a little break in period but nothing excessive. If your looking for a heavy hiker or lighter backpacker, I would highly recommend this boot
customer_reviews.author: john taylor

customer_reviews.title: Solid and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. First one was made in China. I was concerned from some reviews that this pair might be narrower but I bought the same size and they fit perfectly. Have walked maybe 8-10 miles in them -- they already feel broken-in. I really like how easily these boots go on and off.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Genz

customer_reviews.title: Not the boots I've been buying for decades
customer_reviews.text: I've been wearing Sundowners for what seems like decades. Part of what i liked was the nice wide toe box on the wide version; too many shoes and boots pinch my toes. But they've overhauled the line, and the wide boots have the same sort of pinching toe box. No idea if they're as durable and (otherwise) comfortable as the several pairs I had earlier, as the pinching is a dealbreaker.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Vasque but fit way off
customer_reviews.text: I love Vasque boots - served me well over the years. But this boot was way off in the fit. Supposed to be 10W(wide). That's what I wear and what my previous Vasque boots were. These seemed like 9Reg (or even narrow). Sent back and changed model and went up to a 10.5W(wide). They were great and I could have gone with the 10W in that model. So don't know what happened to this Sundowner.
customer_reviews.author: Part Time

customer_reviews.title: Very happy at about 25 total miles.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. Very happy at about 25 total miles. I expected them to be too wide for my foot, so they fit as expected!! I have a AA width foot, so no surprise there. I always put in additional cushioning insoles and wear 2 pairs of medium thick socks to fill the gap. They feel great on my feet. I have been wearing Vasque Sundowners for decades. I do hope the new kind of soles are as good as the Vibram ones. I always have to repair the heels anyway with Freesole due to rounding the edge when I walk.
customer_reviews.author: J. McSwain

customer_reviews.title: Fit like an 8&1/2 C
customer_reviews.text: I still have a pair of the old Italian ones from the 80's, 9EE in size. I had passed on the Chinese models over the years but jumped on these new Vietnameze ones when I discovered them. Ordered 9EE. Fit like an 8&1/2 C. That said if you have feet as narrow as a ruler these new boots are very well made, close in quality to the Italians. The soles are stiffer and probably won't be as comfortable. I trashed them in this review because I despise incorrect sizing with a passion!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: That gave me a real nice fit. These boots are light weight classic hikers ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a half a size to large and wide. Also replaced the foot pad with a thick arch supportive foot pad upon receiving the boots. That gave me a real nice fit. These boots are light weight classic hikers and they were comfortable right out of the box. If they continue to perform and are durable enough I will likely get another pair when these are worn out.
customer_reviews.author: Matt V.

customer_reviews.title: Big drop off from previous versions.
customer_reviews.text: This was my 4th or 5th pair of Sundowners... I got my last pair in 2013ish. These feel like a much lower quality. They don't fit quite right... I ordered 12W, same as the last 3-4 pairs, but they're way too tight on my toes... I suspect they'll stretch out a bit since they're leather, but they don't fit perfectly right out of the box like the previous versions did. I should have listened to all the reviews that said these aren't what they once were.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Boyarsky

customer_reviews.title: The 20 year Boot!
customer_reviews.text: I just received my new Sundowners. So I have not had a lot of time with them. But my first impressions are these. the leather looks great, the fit is right and I can see wearing this for many years to come. Next month I will be Hiking for four days on a mountain. That will be the true test.. I always wanted a pair of sundowners and After numerous attempts on eBay for the Itiaian original and staying clear of the inferior Chinese version . I decided to try this newest rendition . I will update this post in the weeks to come.
customer_reviews.author: aaron srader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and Long Lasting Boots
customer_reviews.text: I have worn these boots for years and they last well and are strong boots. I am an auto mechanic and wear them to work in and love them. They are good for hunting and hiking also. The Goretex is great outside. I think I've worn out 2 pairs but each has taken several years of lots of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Imhntn

customer_reviews.title: Great boot. I am in the landscape construction industry
customer_reviews.text: Great boot. I am in the landscape construction industry, and typically destroy boots way more expensive than these. For the first two weeks, be ready to feel like you are wearing roller blades, and you will be sore. Chalk that up i guess to the great leather quality and boot craftsmanship. After the break in period, these boots are incredible. Feels like you are wearing well made comfortable hiking sneakers. Very stable, good traction, and easy to take on and off. Recommend highly. IF I had do give a con, when it is really cold out you may need to double up on socks.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Finnerty

customer_reviews.title: Vasque Vietnam models are spot on!  Well done!
customer_reviews.text: A friend of mine had a pair of these in college and his was the Italian models. Years later, I decided to buy them and waited until the Vietnam models became available. Glad I did. I normally wear a 12 in most shoes and 13 in running shoes. I am more or less a 12.5 M (which are rare). I bought a 13 and they fit perfectly on me. Just enough room for boot socks without being snug or too loose. The leather is nice and applied some Nikwax. I have not put them through the paces, but I will need to break them in a bit. Nice leather and great fiit so far.
customer_reviews.author: DLNAO

customer_reviews.title: Too narrow
customer_reviews.text: These are great looking and well made boots. They are too narrow for my feet. I normally wear a 13 normal width boot but will be ordering a 13 wide. Since I wrote the above review, I have received my pair of 13 wide boots. These fit me perfect. Have been wearing them to work for a week and they already feel 90% broken in. I think I found a winner for boots.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Exceeded My Expectations!
customer_reviews.text: I discovered Vasque hiking boots in 1987. I could not afford them then. As years passed I just never would justify them. Finally, I bought them. They are my favorite shoes right now. I love being able to swap the red laces for a look change as well. They are comfortable enough to wear all day. I would buy them again in a heartbeat. It was worth the wait!
customer_reviews.author: P. Revier

customer_reviews.title: my 3rd pair, same size, way too small
customer_reviews.text: I hate buying shoes online for this reason. Have had these same boots twice before over past..about 20 years. first two pairs fit comfortably first time, every time. I ordered the same size, and the boots are way too small. Product seems good quality but i dont understand why they cannot be consistent with sizing over the years. My suggestion: dont buy this product online unless you order several sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Schuster

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for me!
customer_reviews.text: I go a half size up in these. Wore my first pair for three+ years nonstop. Work, hiking, hanging out. Tried the skywalk too and I prefer the fit of these. Love them! Hope they keep the suede hawthorne option because it's my number one shoe when it's not Birkenstock weather.
customer_reviews.author: matt casey

customer_reviews.title: Quality boot!
customer_reviews.text: I had to order up a half size and wide. I typically wear a size US10 in Merrell, Nike, etc. I ended up with a US10.5W with this boot. They seem to be a quality boot. I'm still in the break-in process with them. My left heel seems to quickly find a hot spot so I'm working through that. Otherwise, they have kept my feet dry and have been pretty comfortable for all-day wear. I'll be using these for SAR activities so they'll need to stand up to mud, water, logs, briers, plenty of terrain, and lots of foot miles.
customer_reviews.author: rcole

customer_reviews.title: Great boots, but narrow.
customer_reviews.text: Nice boots. I've been wearing these for many years (I'm retired from the US Forest Service and these were my daily wear). This latest pair are breaking in more easily than the last two pairs, so that's a plus. On the down side, they are narrow (and I ordered W). Shoe sizing isn't rocket science; Vasque should get this right after all these years. All in all, keepers.
customer_reviews.author: Old Forester

customer_reviews.title: Size runs small
customer_reviews.text: The 12's I purchased don't fit... too small and cramping toes. All other shoes I wear and have worn over the years are size 12 and fit fine. I gave it some time, because full leather boots take some weeks to break in... but that didn't help, and now its too late to return ! So it goes , I'll end up selling these and ordering another pair, because they are well made and great boots
customer_reviews.author: Walter Krukowski

customer_reviews.title: Great Boots
customer_reviews.text: I love these boots. I had a pair of Asolo TPX and they wrenched my right Achilles tendon, just in everyday wear. I bought these Sundowners, threw some mink oil on them, and they automatically felt like a million bucks. I can wear these every day and they're super sturdy and unbelievably comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Talkinator

customer_reviews.title: Not the Sundowner boots of the past.
customer_reviews.text: These are to replace a pair I bought a good number of years ago. I'm a bit disappointed: Instead of a 9W, I had to reorder a 10W, and even these are a little tight on 9W feet. Break in is still ongoing - my previous pairs were broke in within an hour of wearing and maybe, maybe a mile of walking. These new Sundowner boots have over 5 miles and at least 10 hours of foot time with no break in as of yet. I would return for a refund, but I feel that I've worn them too long for them to be accepted.
customer_reviews.author: Kansasmedic

customer_reviews.title: Awesome but order a size up and save the return and reordering
customer_reviews.text: Love these boots. They look 10X better than the old ones I have. The leather looks amazing but the size runs small. I read the reviews on ordering a size up but decided to go with my regular size of 10.5 which is all I wear in boots. The fit good except that my toes had no room and was at the end of the boot. I waited to write a review because I just received the one size up 11 and the fit perfect. The boots looks and feels great. Don't make the mistake I did and so order a size up and you'll be fine.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Conatser

customer_reviews.title: Nice boots
customer_reviews.text: My husband bought these as replacements for his old hiking boots which he nearly wore out. He wore them around the house for several days to make sure about the fit. Today he wore than outside and said they were great so far.
customer_reviews.author: Montana shops

customer_reviews.title: So far so good.
customer_reviews.text: Time will tell, but I bought these to replace a 20-yr old pair of Vasques I had been wearing. I know they aren't what they used to be, but the boots seem sturdy and well-made. The design is classic and sharp; I could wear these to a wedding. Especially if the wedding was out-of-doors.
customer_reviews.author: Craig Z

customer_reviews.title: Well Worth the Investment
customer_reviews.text: My first pair of Vasque Sundowners lasted almost 20 years with very little wear on the soles until the right one came unglued. I always wanted a pair in black. As soon as I bought these and laced them up, one of the quick lace hooks popped out of the leather! Not even 20 minute of wear! Amazon replaced them and I'm very happy. These are the best hiking boots and I expect years of service. In years past, I would spend $100 on a pair of boots that would only last a year. These are twice the money, but will last 20 times as long!
customer_reviews.author: Bret A. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great all purpose boot. True to width, so don’t hesitate to order a wide if you need it. Nice looking boot. Waterproof. Takes a little while to break in. Good for every day and light hiking and trekking. My “walk-out” boots.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Margello

customer_reviews.title: No current issues, satisfied!
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn these on several hikes over 8 miles, and my feet have stayed completely dry and no aches or cramping. I would recommend these boots, but I’ll come back to this comment in about a year and update you on how they’ve held up durability wise.
customer_reviews.author: ParkEriz

customer_reviews.title: bought in 2016.  now way smaller
customer_reviews.text: This review by Stan Love these boots, have bought them for years. Last bought in 2016 so just hit re-order. so small they hurt my feet just putting one on. sending them back.
customer_reviews.author: Annette R. Miller

customer_reviews.title: love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: love these shoes. I erroneously thought Amazon had packaged these wrong. I made a mistake. Everything is perfect!!!! had these in high school 20 years ago. am glad that the quality is back
customer_reviews.author: Rich P

customer_reviews.title: Love this Boot
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing this boot since the 90's. Always order the same size. Always a great fit, and they wear a long time. Never had a leak, and I am tough on boots.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy to Still be Able to Buy These Boots
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing the different version of these boots since 1993. I have worn the Black version as all around boots for work and play for the last 8 years or so. The Sundowners fit my feet the same every time. Great boot with great support and glove-like fit. My only worry is that when these wear out, the Sundowner model won't be available any more. I am tempted to buy another pair for the future so that won't happen. They are worth the price accorded to what my feet tell me.
customer_reviews.author: Fishahead

customer_reviews.title: Smaller that it appears
customer_reviews.text: Have only worn 4 times hurt my foot would like a larger size
customer_reviews.author: Larry Scruggs

customer_reviews.title: Pretty close to the originals
customer_reviews.text: Size/fit is that of the originals as they used the Vasque “last”since 2015. Meaning the boot is built on the same mold. Break-in period is going to be longer as they are very stiff. I opted to put King Ranch leather conditioner and plan to do so a couple more times as I work them in. Overall I’m very satisfied with the purchase. Wish they had Vibram soles as the new ones are rigid and don't see them giving in easily.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Parker

customer_reviews.title: Too wide for my feet
customer_reviews.text: I have narrow feet (C) and I couldn't even get this shoe tight enough to wear. My foot was flopping around inside like crazy. Sucks because it's a really nice shoe of high quality. Wish they made it in a narrow size.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Hanan

customer_reviews.title: Great fit. Great look.
customer_reviews.text: Fit great. Look great. 10 years ago I bought a pair of the Vasque Sundowner boots, and they have been great. These new versions look very similar to (but not exactly the same as) the old version ones, which is great. The new version seems to be better quality. They are definitely more comfortable. I’m very happy with them. These are my everyday boots, both in and out of the office. I’m considering buying another pair to use exclusively for hiking and hunting. Thank you Vasque for your commitment to quality, and for keeping this great boot available.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Hiltz

customer_reviews.title: I still wear the old ones but the leather is getting too soft for good support for long trail hikes
customer_reviews.text: Bought this pair to replace my old pair of Sundowners I purchased in 1989. I still wear the old ones but the leather is getting too soft for good support for long trail hikes. I used Snow Seal (bees wax) to treat the old pair, and have done same for new pair. These are the most comfortable boots I have ever worn!
customer_reviews.author: Werner

customer_reviews.title: Nearly the same as the first version - Fit and style are outstanding
customer_reviews.text: I still wear the first version of these boots. I've had them rebuilt twice. And, I wear the second China-made version. I love the first and don't like the China-made. This, third version is nearly exactly like the first. Fit, style, etc. All wonderful. I highly recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: David Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking boot but I only gave three stars because they’re not very comfortable. You’ll probably have to buy some additional padding for the inside. Definitely not an everyday boot for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Big L

customer_reviews.title: Very good fit.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this shoe before when they were made in Italy. This Vietnamese model comes close to Italian quality. Nice fit and finish. Not quite as trim and sleek as Italian-made, but very good so far.
customer_reviews.author: Wyo Doc

customer_reviews.title: Nice boot, very narrow
customer_reviews.text: This is a great looking boot. My husband read the reviews and ordered a wide width and a half size bigger than normal. It was tight all over. Sending them back going to try another 1/2 size up.
customer_reviews.author: sandy

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable, Multi-Purpose Boots (Initial Impressions)
customer_reviews.text: 09/24/17 - I received these boots about one week ago and have been wearing them daily as a uniform piece (I work for a federal land management agency) walking an average of 5-6 miles per day. I haven't undergone any tough hikes with these boots yet, but they fit as expected and I haven't experienced any hot spots / rubbing. I'm very pleased with the boots and am eager to see how they hold up on rough terrain. I will update this review after a few months of wear with comments on their durability and fit.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Ackerman

customer_reviews.title: Look no further, the classic is king.
customer_reviews.text: You just cannot do better than this boot. My first pair lasted me 16 years, and I only had to part with them because I sliced them open with a machete, it was so sad I still have them. There is no reason to look anywhere else, this boot is it. Nothing else will compare, nothing else will last. Vasque is where it is at! I even heard Saint Paul had a pair. Oh, and epstein didn't kill himself.
customer_reviews.author: william Ingram

customer_reviews.title: Perfect with the wide size!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great! I wear a 9.5 in Merrell boots so I got a 9.5 except I listened to other reviews and got wides. The length fits perfectly and I'm glad I got wides cause the width is also perfect which I was surprised cause I have wide flat feet. They fit like a glove! Will likely update this review in a year as the leather is soft yet sturdy and I imagine will take anywhere from 6 months to a year to actually break in.
customer_reviews.author: DiscGolf Hiker

customer_reviews.title: Meaty lugs and fit like a glove once broken in
customer_reviews.text: It took some miles to break these bad boys in. Best to stay on the flats for a few weeks but the tread is meaty and sticks well to slick conditions including thick mud and slippery river crossings.
customer_reviews.author: Jason S.

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: I love this boot. I've been hiking since 1998, this is my third pair of Vasque Sundowner's since then. Excellent quality and very durable. They take a bit to break in but once they are they're amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots especially for people with thin feet.
customer_reviews.text: The boots remind me of the first sundowners that I ever owned (1992). I love the old school tread pattern and the way they change your stride to a more heel to toe feel; which is less apparent in the last style change. The toe box should be made bigger and I also liked the padded tongue and the extra padding in the opening that was on the last sundowner. I hope they make that boot some day that combines the old school bottom with the changes made to the upper leather side.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Different fit from the norm
customer_reviews.text: I’ve worn Sundowners for years and these are a different fit (Vasque said they were from a new supplier when contacted via Twitter)
customer_reviews.author: Jon Karner

customer_reviews.title: Happy Hubby
customer_reviews.text: Hubby very happy. He said they are a little tight but he loves them enough to break them in.
customer_reviews.author: Katrina Read

customer_reviews.title: Small fit
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes but returning due to small for. It's the second pair I've owned. Order a size up!
customer_reviews.author: yogini

customer_reviews.title: Fits and feel good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Got these to stand up all day in a wet environment at work. All day comfort. No break in period needed
customer_reviews.author: P. Jimenez

customer_reviews.title: Runs small
customer_reviews.text: The Vasque are not like the ones I remember back in the mid 90's. This size runs small and narrow. Like one reviwer suggested, get the wide and 1/2 size bigger. I am exchanging mine.
customer_reviews.author: Elroy H.

customer_reviews.title: Come on Vasquez, get a clue, many reviews state shoes run too small.
customer_reviews.text: Receiving my Sundowners today I really wanted to like them. However, they were ridiculously small. I wear a 10 1/2 EE so ordered 11W.
customer_reviews.author: bobinmontana

customer_reviews.title: Still liking Vasque boots
customer_reviews.text: So far I love these. They do take a little breaking in so be patient. Vasque can run narrow so I ordered a wide size and they fit great. I have owned 4 pairs of Vasque before but this is the first time I’ve tried the Sundowner. Great quality.
customer_reviews.author: Firelock

customer_reviews.title: Take time to break in
customer_reviews.text: Take the time to break them in. I wear them around the house after work. Once broken in, they are the best boots. A single piece of leather wraps the boot-so minimal seams for possible water intrusion.
customer_reviews.author: corey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hiking or walking boots
customer_reviews.text: Excellent boots. I have worn these for years and have never had a regret. They are waterproof and comfortable and wear well.
customer_reviews.author: J.C. H.

customer_reviews.title: Where style meets dependability
customer_reviews.text: Get a size up especially if you’re a half size. Broke in within a few days of constant use. Not much arch support so insoles are needed. Completely waterproof yet the materials breathes. An Uber driver started pulling away as I getting in and ran over my heel in these boots. If it wasn’t for the thick, well built sole he’d have crushed my foot. Boots took getting ran over and were completely fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Real? Idk
customer_reviews.text: Im still trying to figure out if this is an authentic item. The etched logo on the upper outside of the boots isnt as pronounced as the pic.
customer_reviews.author: nay

customer_reviews.title: ... are now made in Vietnam and they don't fit like they used to
customer_reviews.text: I note that these boots are now made in Vietnam and they don't fit like they used to. However, the workmanship and color seem better. I'm sending them back and ordering the next size up, so be advised that they run small.
customer_reviews.author: HKB

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking boot
customer_reviews.text: This is my third pair of this boot. They are very comfortable and made to last.
customer_reviews.author: Joann M. Burke

customer_reviews.title: Good mid weight boot for 3 season outdoor wear
customer_reviews.text: I have worn this boot for decades. They wear great and feel like comfortable house shoes right out of the box. Awesome tread pattern. Keeps your feet dry and the smooth leather doesn’t hold mud or water as does suede
customer_reviews.author: JOXDOC

customer_reviews.title: Not your dad's Vasques
customer_reviews.text: I've had two pairs of sundowners going back to the early 90s. Vasque has completely changed the fit on these new ones. Stiff, narrow, and small. Those are not good qualities in a boot you intend to wear in the wilderness, for days at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Worst hiking boot I’ve owned
customer_reviews.text: Worst hiking boots I have owned!! Been hiking/climbing for 20 plus years
customer_reviews.author: Willis r Dillman jr

customer_reviews.title: Vasque Sudowners are great
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing these Sundowners for many years now and I still love the support they give when you walk and climb up steep terrain the traction is very good both going up and down
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Mickel

customer_reviews.title: Great boot
customer_reviews.text: Didn’t realize that they ran narrow. Exchanged with size 11. Came yesterday (right away) and am super pleased with the fit and quality. I recommend up sizing 1/2 or 1 size. Leaves room for an extra pair of socks too.
customer_reviews.author: restorevt

customer_reviews.title: Great stiff boot
customer_reviews.text: These just arrived today, and I’m enjoying breaking my feet into these beautiful retro-style high quality boots.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Phil G.

customer_reviews.title: good boots
customer_reviews.text: nice boots, but not as good as the Italy made of the past. still very nice boots. buy 1/2 size larger.
customer_reviews.author: ***shop***

customer_reviews.title: Had to go a Half size up plus chose wide
customer_reviews.text: I wear a 9 and had to go a half size up and choose wide fit perfectly now..Still a super classic 5 star's from me
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: My early impression regarding quality is that these are gonna be pretty bulletproof. Very pleased with these boots
customer_reviews.text: First pair of Vasque boots I've owned. I have what I consider average-width feet, and generally wear a US mens size nine across most brands. The medium width nines I ordered fit perfectly after a very brief break-in period. To me, these certainly don't run large/wide, but really not OVERLY small/narrow in my opinion. My early impression regarding quality is that these are gonna be pretty bulletproof. Very pleased with these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best hiking boots made. Period. Highest quality, best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.text: The best hiking boots made. Period. I'd had another pair, in size 12, but my feet have gotten bigger, these size 13s fit perfectly. Highest quality, best bang for your buck.
customer_reviews.author: Austin guy

customer_reviews.title: Fore a wide boot more like a snug regular width
customer_reviews.text: I ordered a 13 Wide fit was to tight also had problems with a pressure point at the ankle, part me part the boot design. I have other Vasque boots in 13D that fit fine Not the case with this style of boot. Other wise well made boot,
customer_reviews.author: Lee

customer_reviews.title: Size
customer_reviews.text: I saw its size would be fit so it'd be good to buy 1/2 bigger one, but it's normal 9 size. Usually I wear 9 for running shoes. I like simple design and durability. I'll wear it at least 5 years. Thx
customer_reviews.author: Taeyoung

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is smaller then it used to be.
customer_reviews.text: My current Sundowners are size 9M so I ordered the same size. The newer boots were shorter and narrower.
customer_reviews.author: orsnowman

customer_reviews.title: Get a size bigger
customer_reviews.text: Great boot, waterproof, sturdy, comfy, very nice look. Only thing you want to do is make sure you get a size larger then what you actually wear. I wear 10 in men US bought a pair and they didn’t fit bought the 11 wide and I wear them everyday love the product.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew minard

customer_reviews.title: Great pair of boots-great price!!!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great! I will never hike in these, I got these based on how they look, & they look awesome!
customer_reviews.author: Fresh to Death!

customer_reviews.title: These are very durable.
customer_reviews.text: I had the original Vasque Sundowners but did not have the revised versions. Since the new ones are supposed to be more like the originals, I thought I would renew. I originally bought the Sundowners because of the GoreTex lining.
customer_reviews.author: Tsuneo Larry Oda

customer_reviews.title: But otherwise well constructed but not designed at the angle for good fit. Too loose
customer_reviews.text: I bought a size larger as suggested by others online. Have to wrap old socks with ends cut out around angles because boots are not constructed properly. But otherwise well constructed but not designed at the angle for good fit. Too loose.
customer_reviews.author: Larry A.

customer_reviews.title: Nice, older school leather hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: Older style hiking boots that take some time to break in. Get them a little bigger than you wear in street shoes so you can fit in thicker socks. Nice tread and support.
customer_reviews.author: hodag

customer_reviews.title: Worn these for 30 years with new pair every 3 ...
customer_reviews.text: Worn these for 30 years with new pair every 3 years or so. As production has shifted from one country to another quality as dropped. This pair is tighter than earlier ones. The boots have remained stiff much longer than previous pairs.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: I've been waring Vasque Sundowners since I was 19-years old ...
customer_reviews.text: I've been waring Vasque Sundowners since I was 19-years old (I'm 45 now). This recent modification to the old classic boot has several subtle improvements while remaining true to the original comfort / flexibility of the shoe. I wear these boots just as confidently in the woods as I do in the office or at a formal affair. On the South Carolina Coast, this is the only shoe I wear NOV-MARCH for business. Period.
customer_reviews.author: alice k.

customer_reviews.title: The D width fits like a B width and will take some stretching to ...
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Vasque Sundowners for 27 years. It is obvious that they are no longer built by the same people. The D width fits like a B width and will take some stretching to be comfortable. I hope these last as long as the old ones.
customer_reviews.author: James Stauffer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome boot
customer_reviews.text: Husband is a size 7 i order this boot in a 9.5.tje fit is a bit snug however he is breaking into them..
customer_reviews.author: carmen matos

customer_reviews.title: Dope boot!
customer_reviews.text: Let me first say I’m from NYC and will likely never hike a day in my life, BUT - these boots right here are very stylish. And if your looking for a boot that has “swag” look no further. Btw- only wear the red laces - toss the blues. The red brings the boot to life
customer_reviews.author: Matt Turn

customer_reviews.title: Way too small and narrow. Size up!
customer_reviews.text: I am universally a 10.5 and these are way too small and narrow in this size. Wish I could return them but I wore them once and got horrible blisters so now it appears I'm stuck with them. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew D. Hickey

customer_reviews.title: Best boots ever!
customer_reviews.text: This is the only shoe my husband wears. He has a foot that tries to turn in and drag, and this boot corrects that.
customer_reviews.author: Gaylene Byrd

customer_reviews.title: Too snalk
customer_reviews.text: These are great boots but they did not fit my husband
customer_reviews.author: Nancy E. Jacobson

customer_reviews.title: I bought 8. 5 size which is my size ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought 8.5 size which is my size. It's feels a little tight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boots
customer_reviews.text: Bought these boots for my husband! He loves these boots... he says they’re the most comfortable boots he’s owned!
customer_reviews.author: Rosemarie Perez

customer_reviews.title: this used to be a great boot
customer_reviews.text: what ever they have done to this boot has ruined it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A wonderful purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is a wonderful addition to my shoe collection I will purchase another pair again definitely a lot of good support for a big man I am 6 foot 4 inches tall and 330 lb they support me very well
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Fits as expected it's ok to get your normal size.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Hamlett

customer_reviews.title: I love them. They are very durable and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I've been buying these boots for over 20 years. I love them. They are very durable and comfortable. However, I do have one issue. They were delivered in a generic nonretail box.
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas W.

product_meta.title: Vasque Men's Sundowner GTX-m
feature_bullets: Ankle-high hiking and backpacking boots featuring speed lacing system with D-ring hooks
2.4mm Red Wing leather upper, tanned in the US
Cambered heel for efficient hiking stride
